comments.content: Though it was just recently designed, the Font Bureau’s [Escrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211401/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Escrow) is based on a similar style and its weights and size (Display and Text) variations might be the best option here.
Escrow’s a good idea, Stephen. Thanks. Though I wish i good find something that had a bit more of a vintage flavor to it ...

I hear you. More vintage Scotches:

[Modern Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211401/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner_flake/modern_extended/)  
 [Monotype Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211401/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/monotype_modern_std/)  
 [DeVinne](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211401/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/devinne_ot/) and [DeVinne Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211401/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/devinne_text_ot/)  
 [Scotch Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211401/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/mt_scotch_roman_std/)

Thanks for the lovely list! Lots to think about.

Very much appreciated.
